Chrysler emerged from bankruptcy in June 2009 and is now under the management control of Italy's Fiat SpA, which has a 25 percent stake in the U.S. automaker. Sergio Marchionne is also CEO of Fiat. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions, Sergio Marchionne said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Mr Eric Schmidt said.
